thread.title: Jeremy Guthrie gives Champagne-soaked ALCS hat to lucky fan

author: Chris Oberholtz, Multimedia Producer
title: Jeremy Guthrie gives Champagne-soaked ALCS hat to lucky fan
text:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - One lucky Royals fan will soon be the proud owner of a Champagne-soaked hat that belonged to pitcher Jeremy Guthrie.
He took to Twitter to surprise a fan who retweeted a photo of him wearing it.
Guthrie joked that his hat "still smelled of celebration." He then told Twitter followers he would give it to someone who retweeted him, and more than 5,000 people did.
My LCS hat smells of celebration, I'll give it to a follower that RT's this. #TakeTheCrown **winner chosen Monday pic.twitter.com/XZSsL5yVgA 
— Jeremy Guthrie (@TheRealJGuts) October 24, 2015 When the Royals celebrated winning the American League pennant Friday night, Guthrie was in the midst of the soggy crowd.
"This group of guys has worked really hard since day one," Guthrie said.
He snapped a picture with his official American League champions hat and decided a Royals fan should have it. 
"I have the hat. It stinks like Champagne. Hopefully some lucky fan who will appreciate it can have it," he said.
 Twitter fans quickly hit retweet.
I see those RT's...and the hat still smells pic.twitter.com/KoaO2n6Ov6 
— Jeremy Guthrie (@TheRealJGuts) October 25, 2015 "Every half hour I screen shot people to limit it to a few hundred. Ponch over at Mix 93.3 is going to help me come up with a random way to choose somebody."
I am taking occasional screen shots of the Retweet https://t.co/UV9zNgBKTs are10 recent followers that are finalists pic.twitter.com/cv5c6xQNUa 
— Jeremy Guthrie (@TheRealJGuts) October 24, 2015 In order to have the piece of history, you'll have to put up with some stench. 
"Not too bad ... I think the smell drops out as it hangs in the locker. It's authentic," Guthrie said. "I'll say the name, and they'll give me there address, and I may give it to them in person if they are local or send it to them if they are not local."
Guthrie said he'd pick his winner Monday. So far he has not chosen the lucky winner.
